column3: This points out that we don't have a strong enough api contract to support an external UniValue :\
I recommend we instead threshold the univalue version.  They have been security issues in older versions... esp since as a library I don't believe it's actually maintained.
This makes the code slightly better readable so seems OK to me.\n\nA minimum threshold for univalue would be a sane thing to do though. I didn't know we supported external univalue at all.
